lines.text: There's always a bigger fish.
How feel you?
Cold, sir.
Afraid are you?
No, sir.
See through you we can.
Be mindful of your feelings.
Your thoughts dwell on your mother.
I miss her.
Afraid to lose her I think, hmm?
What has that got to do with anything?
Everything! Fear is the path to the dark side. Fear leads to anger. Anger leads to hate. Hate leads to suffering. I sense much fear in you.
You're a Jedi Knight, aren't you?
What makes you think that?
I saw your laser sword. Only Jedi carry that kind of weapon.
Perhaps I killed a Jedi and took it from him.
I don't think so. No one can kill a Jedi.
I wish that were so.
But Master Yoda says I should be mindful of the future.
But not at the expense of the moment.
[R2D2 beeps]
I beg your pardon, but what do you mean, "naked?"
[R2D2 beeps]
My parts are showing? Oh, my goodness, oh!
Remember, concentrate on the moment. Feel, don't think. Trust your instincts.
Always two there are, no more, no less. A master and an apprentice.
But which was destroyed, the master or the apprentice?
Mom, you said that the biggest problem in the universe is no one helps each other.
Your focus determines your reality.
You must have Jedi reflexes if you race pods.
[Jar-Jar tries to grab a piece of fruit with his tongue, but Qui-Gon catches it]
Don't do that again.
Ooh mooey mooey I love you!
You almost got us killed! Are you brainless?
I spake!
The ability to speak does not make you intelligent. Now get out of here.
You're a slave?
I'm a person and my name is Anakin.
You can't stop change any more than you can stop the suns from setting.
Are you an angel?
What?
An angel. I've heard the deep space pilots talk about them. They live on the moons of Iego, I think. They're the most beautiful creatures in the universe.
You're a funny little boy. How do you know so much?
I listen to all the traders and star pilots who come through here. I'm a pilot, you know, and someday I'm going to fly away from this place.
Wipe them out, all of them.
I can only protect you, I cannot fight a war for you.
Why do I get the feeling that we've picked up another pathetic life form?
The boy is dangerous. They all sense it, why can't you?

[to Anakin]
May the force be with you.
Master Qui-Gon. More to say have you?
With your permission, my master, I have encountered a vergence in the Force.
A vergence, you say?
Located around a person?
A boy. His cells have the highest concentration of midi-chlorians I have seen in a life-form. It was possible he was concieved by the midi-chlorians.
You refer to the prophecy of The One who will bring balance to the Force. You believe it's this boy?
[Anakin is about to leave his mother behind to train as a Jedi]
I can't do it, Mom. I just can't do it.
Ani...
Will I ever see you again?
What does your heart tell you?
I hope so. Yes... I guess.
Then we will see each other again.
I will come back and free you, Mom. I promise.
Now, be brave, and don't look back. Don't look back.
All slaves have a transmitter placed somewhere in their body.
I've been working on a scanner to try and locate mine.
Any attempt to escape...
And they blow you up! BOOM!
How wude!
Finding him was the will of the force, I have no doubt of that.
And Queen Amidala, has she signed the treaty?
She has... disappeared, my lord. One Naboo cruiser got past the blockade.
I want that treaty signed!
M-my lord, it-it's impossible to locate the ship. It's out of our range.
Not for a Sith.
[Darth Maul appears alongside Darth Sideous in the hologram]
This is my apprentice, Darth Maul. He will find your lost ship.
[the hologram disappears]
This is getting out of hand! Now, there are *two* of them!

[mumbles, as Obi-Wan sits him up after battle with Darth Maul]
Uhh, it's too late, it...
No!
Obi-Wan, promise... Promise me you will train the boy.
Yes, master.

[wiping a tear from Obi-Wan's right cheek]
He is the chosen one. He will bring balance. Train him.
[nods, cries over Qui-Gon Jinn's body]
How are you going to pay for all this?
I have twenty thousand Republic dataries.
Republic credits? Republic credits are no good out here. I need something more real.
I don't have anything else...
[waves hand]
But credits will do fine.
No, they won't-a.
[Qui-Gon waves his hand more firmly]
Credits will do fine.
No, they won't-a. What? You think you're some kind of Jedi, waving your hand around like that? I'm a Toydarian. Mind tricks don't work on me. Only money. No money, no parts, no deal!
There is no civility, only politics.
I was not elected to watch my people suffer and die while you discuss this invasion in a committee!
But what about mom? Is she free too? You're coming too, aren't you mom?
I tried to free your mother Anni, but Watto wouldn't have it.
Son, my place is here, my future is here. It is time for you to let go.
Keep your concentration here and now, where it belongs.
[first lines]
Captain.
Yes, sir?
Tell them we wish to board at once.

[to communication device]
With all due respect, the ambassadors for the Supreme Chancellor wish to board immediately.

[on view screen]
Yes, of course. As you know, our blockade is perfectly legal and we'd be happy to receive the ambassadors.
Hello, I am C-3PO, human cyborg relations. How might I serve you?
Are you sure about this? Trusting our fate to a boy we hardly know? The Queen will not approve.
The Queen does not need to know.
Well, I don't approve.
May the force be with you.
I'm not allowed to train you, so I want you watch me and be mindful. Always remember, your focus determines your reality.
There was no father. I carried him, I gave birth, I raised him. I can't explain what happened.
[first title cards]
A long time ago in a galaxy far, far away...

Turmoil has engulfed the Galactic Republic. The taxation of trade routes to outlying star systems is in dispute. Hoping to resolve the matter with a blockade of deadly battleships, the greedy Trade Federation has stopped all shipping to the small planet of Naboo. While the Congress of the Republic endlessly debates this alarming chain of events, the Supreme Chancellor has secretly dispatched two Jedi Knights, the guardians of peace and justice in the galaxy, to settle the conflict...
I need to speak to the Jedi Council. The situation has become much more complicated.
Greed can be a very powerful ally.
Wesa got a grand army. That's why you no liking us meesa thinks.
Tatooine is sparsely populated. If the homing trace is correct, I will find them quickly, Master.
Move against the Jedi first. You will then have no difficulty in taking the Queen back to Naboo to sign the treaty.
At last we will reveal ourselves to the Jedi. At last we will have revenge.
You have been well trained my young apprentice. They will be no match for you.

[describing his encounter with Darth Maul]
He had all the lightsaber fighting capabilities and the moves of the Jedi, only faster and more agressive. My only conclusion... is that it was a Sith lord.
Impossible! The Sith are extinct! They have been for nearly a millenium.
I agree. The Sith would not have returned without us sensing it.
Hard to see, the dark side is. We must investigate further before drawing a conclusion to the idenity of your adversary.
Monsters out there, leaking in here. Weesa all sinking and no power. Whena yousa thinking we are in trouble?
Better dead here than deader in the Core. Ye gods, whatta meesa sayin'?
And you, young Skywalker; we shall watch your career with great interest.
Hey, you-sa! Stop-pa dere!
Hey yo, Daddy, Captain Tarpals. Mesa back.
No-ah 'gain, Jar Jar. You-sa goin' to da Bosses. You-sa in big doo-doo dis time!
[Jar Jar gets shocked by a Gungan spear]
Yipe! How wude!
Anakin Skywalker, meet Obi-Wan Kenobi.
Senator, this is your arena. I feel I must return my mine. I have decided to go back to Naboo.
Go back? But your Majesty, be realistic. They'll force you to sign the treaty.
I will sign no treaty, Senator. My fate will be no different to that of our people.
Qui-Gon's defiance I sense in you. Need that, you do not!
Now this is pod racing!
invasion.
I have... acquired a pod in a game of chance. The fastest ever built.
I hope you didn't kill anyone I know for it.
I want to see your spaceship the moment the race is over.
Patience, my blue friend.
The council has granted me permission to train you. You will be a Jedi, I promise.
I've built a racer. It's the fastest ever! There's a big race tomorrow on Boonta Eve. You could enter my pod. It's all but finished...
Anakin, Watto won't let you...
Watto, doesn't know I've built it. You could make him think it was yours and you could get him to let me pilot it for you.
I don't want you to race Anni, it's awful. I die every time Watto makes you do it.
But mom, I love it. The prize money would more than pay for the parts they need.
You were right about one thing, master. The negotiations were short.
Yoosa should follow me now, okeeday?

[speaking to Chancellor Palpatine]
It is clear to me now that the Republic no longer functions. I pray you will bring sanity and compassion back to the Senate.
Mesa cause one, two-y little bitty axadentes, huh? Yud say boom de gasser, den crashin der bosses heyblibber, den banished.
What are midi-chlorians?
Midi-chlorians are a microscopic life form that resides within all living cells.

[Sees R2-D2 and other R2 units for the first time]
Hello boyos.
Exsqueeze me...
You and the Naboo form a symbiont circle, what happens to one of you affects the other, you must understand this.
How did you end up here with us?
I don't know. Mesa day startin pretty okee-day with a brisky morning munchy, then BOOM! Gettin very scared and grabbin that Jedi and POW! Mesa here! Mesa gettin' very very scared!
[laser fire surrounds Naboo Starfighter. R2D2 beeps]
I know we're in trouble, just hang on!
You were banished because you were clumsy?
[after a pod racer crashes and explodes into a billion pieces]
I don't care what universe you're from, that's got to hurt.
This scheme of yours has failed, Lord Sidious. The blockades is finished. We dare not go against the Jedi.
Viceroy, I don't want this stunted slime in my sight again!
[regarding returning to Otoh Gunga]
My forgotten, da Bosses will do terrible tings to me TERRRRRIBLE is me going back der!
Do you hear that?
[a rumbling is heard in the distance]
Yeah.
That is the sound of a thousand terrible things headed this way.
If they find us, they will crush us, grind us into TINY pieces and BLAST us into oblivion!
Hmmm... yousa point is well seen.
Do not defy the council, Master, not again.
I shall do what I must, Obi-Wan.
I have a bad feeling about this.
I don't sense anything.
It's not about the mission, Master. It's something... elsewhere. Elusive.
I will not condone a course of action that will lead us to war.
This turn of events is unfortunate. We must accelerate our plans. Begin landing your troops.
My lord, is that... legal?
I will make it legal.
And the Jedi?
The Chancellor should never have brought them into this. Kill them immediately!
I can assure you they will never get me onto one of those dreadful starships.
I will come back and free you mom, I promise.
These Federation types are cowards. The negotiations will be short.
Your highness, this is a battle I do not think we can win.
Our people are dying, Senator. We must do something quickly to stop the Federation.
To be realistic, your Majesty. I think we are going to have to accept Federation control for the time being.
That is something I cannot do.
Once those droids take control of the surface, they will take control of you.

[to Anakin]
Better stop your friend's betting or I'll end up owning him, too.
You won't walk away from this one, you slave scum!
Don't count on it, slimeball!
You're Bantha fodder!
Qui-Gon told me to stay in this cockpit, and that's what I'm going to do!
[after a meeting with Darth Sidious]
You didn't tell him about the missing Jedi.
No need to report that to him until we have something to report!
Can you help him?
I don't know. I didn't actually come here to free slaves.

[wobbling significantly as he starts walking]
I am not sure this floor is entirely stable.
The Federation has gone too far this time.
He can see things before they happen. That's why he appears to have such quick reflexes. It's a Jedi trait.
Anakin! Tell them to take off!
The death toll is catastrophic. We must bow to their wishes. You must contact me.

[to the Queen]
Yousa thinking yousa people ganna die?
Your Highness, under the circumstances, I suggest you come to Coruscant with us.
Thank you, Ambassador. But my place is with my people.
They will kill you if you stay.
Mesa called Jar-Jar Binks. Mesa your humble servant.
May the force be with you.

Although we do not always agree, Your Honor, our two great societies have always lived in peace. The Trade Federation has destroyed all that we have worked so hard to build. If we do not act quickly, all will be lost forever. I ask you to help us... no, I beg you to help us.
[Amidala drops to her knees in front of the Gungan assembly]
We are your humble servants.
[One by one, everyone in Amidala's party gets on one knee in front of the Gungan assembly]
Our fate is in your hands.
Hmmmmm.
[rubs his chin in thought]
Yousa no tinken yousa greater den da Gungans? Mesa like dis. Maybe wesa... bein' friends.
I don't presume...
But you do! Revealed, your opinion is.
Where wesa goin?
Don't worry. The Force will guide us.
Ohh, maxi big da Force. Well dat smells stinkowiff.
Let's get out of here before more droids show up
More? More did you spake?
Dis is nutsen
[looks out window]
Oh Gooberfish
Why were you banished Jar-Jar?
It's a longo taleo buta small part of it would be mesa... clumsy
You were banished because you were clumsy?
Yousa might'n be sayin dat
[Fode and Beed, the two-headed announcer, is calling the podrace]

[in Huttese, subtitled]
We have perfect weather today for the Boonta Classic. The most hazardous of all Podraces.

[in English]
That's absolutely right. And a big turnout here, from all corners of the Outer Rim territories. I see the contestants are making their way out onto the starting grid.
Yes, there they are!
I see Ben Quadinaros from the Tund system.
And Gasgano in the new Ord Pedrovia.
Two time winner, Boles Roor...
On the front line, the reigning champion, Sebulba from Pixelito. By far the favorite today.
And a late entry, Anakin Skywalker, a local boy.
I hope he has better luck this time.
I see the flaggers are moving onto the track.
Will you defer your motion to allow a commission to explore the validity of your accusations?
Fellow Senators, Honored delegates. A tragedy has engulfed our system which started right here with the taxation of Trade Routes.
Oh, maxi big the Force! Well, that smells stinkerwhiff.
Are you brain dead? I'm not going in there with two Jedi! Send a droid.
How rude!
Mesa no carrrrrrin' about the Naboo. The Naboo think they are so smarty. They think their brains so big.
Ah... Vic-tor-ree!
Wipe them out. All of them.
You assume too much.

[to Nute Gunray]
With all due respect...
Mom, you've always said the biggest problem in this Universe is that nobody helps each other.
I don't know if I'll ever see her again, I wanted to say goodbye.
We will tell her for you. We are sure her heart goes with you.
No again! No again! The beings hereabouts are kwazy! We shall be robbed and crunched!
Not likely, we have nothing of value. That's our problem.
[last lines]
Peace!
Ya-hoo!
There is something else behind all this, Your Highness. There's no logic in the Federation's move here. My feelings tell me they will destroy you.
We haven't much time.
Get to your ships!
He owes me what you call a Life Debt.
Binks? Yousa been havin' the life play with thissen hissen?
Uh-huh.
Blurublurublu! Be gone with him!
Count me outa this one. Better dead here than dead at the core. Ye Gods! What is mesa sayin'?
